summary: The Improving Atmospheric River Forecasts Act aims to improve forecasting capabilities for atmospheric rivers, focusing on reducing associated loss of life and property. It mandates pilot projects to enhance subseasonal to seasonal precipitation forecasts for water management, especially in the western United States. It establishes an atmospheric river forecast improvement program to develop actionable forecasts, improve modeling, enhance data assimilation, and strengthen communication of related hazards. The bill also authorizes appropriations for research and development.
